name: Bento (Miguel Feliciano, João Gonçalves)
description:
My grandpa bleeds history.

Bento is a 3D, first-person, interactive narrative. You play as Bento, a man on his last day in jail where he spent the last few years working in a cowshed to reduce his sentence. As you pack your stuff, you will reminisce about your past life and what led you there.

  • True Story: Relive Bento's unique tale when in prison
  • It’s all in the past: Observe old tools, mechanisms, and behaviors
  • Take it easy: A relaxed interactive experience
The true story of Bento

In the late 1970s, Bento was sentenced to 20 years in Alcoentre prison. He would never complete the total time and Bento was out in 8 years due to his good behavior. While in prison, he attended special rehabilitation programs, that included taking care of a farm. What you will play is his last day in the Alcoentre prison farm.

What was Bento’s crime?

One day Bento decided to visit his nephew. When arriving he found that his beloved nephew was being attacked and stabbed by several men. Bento then ran to his house and got himself a shotgun and when arriving he shot one of the attackers in the leg. That man would eventually die in the hospital. Since Bento got the shotgun at his own house, and not in the nephew's location, the judge considered that he had plenty of time to reflect on his intended action and it wasn’t a rushed act. Bento was convicted for 20 years.

Controls
  • WASD - Walk
  • E - Interact
  • MOUSE 1 - Skip frase
